24.m: And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose. - Romans 8:28 (ESV)

l.q: As saints, what can we hope for in the midst of the sufferings of this present time?
l.a: As saints, we can look forward to the time when we will finally be reunited with God as His sons in Christ and be redeemed from our sufferings.

l.q: Who helps us in our weakness?
l.a: The Spirit helps us in our weakness by interceding for us in prayer.

l.q: In verse 28, what is the comfort of those who love God?
l.a: All things work together for good for those who love God and are called according to His purpose.

l.q: Verses 37-39 states that nothing can separate us from the love of God. How so?
l.a: If we are in Christ, nothings can separate us from the love of God because we have already been cleansed and redeemed by the blood of Christ and we can eagerly await for the time when we will finally be reunited with God. Jesus Christ is our hope even in the midst of sufferings and persecution.
